comment.author: 51039755@N05
comment._content: The caption and the lack of recognition stripes suggest this was taken in march 1918 when 3rd Tank Battalion were sent forward to tackle the Kaiserschlacht offensive. The whippets were designed as mechanised cavalry to be used in the exploitation role once the enemies front had been breached. Source: sites.google.com/site/landships/home/narratives/1918/kais... I'm no expert but I'm pretty sure cavalry were not used in advance of the infantry to break the enemies line in the first world war.
